moves.1. e4 c6 2. d4 d5: Normally this defense produces solid positions and slow, drawn-out positional battles... but not this time.
moves.3. Nc3 dxe4 4. Nxe4 Nf6: Tartakower follows the original methods of Horatio Caro and Marcus Kann. A popular move today is 4...N-Q2, to be followed up by N(1)-B3 so as to recapture with the QN if White exchanges on KB6.
moves.5. Qd3: Reti declares his willingness to attack.
moves.5... e5: Tartakower ripostes with a center thrust.
moves.6... Qa5+ 7. Bd2 Qxe5: Tartakower regains the Pawn and centralizes his Queen. He next needs to get his King to safety.
moves.8... Nxe4: Tartakower grabs thoughtlessly. 8...B-K2 would have guarded the entry square on Q8 and prepared for K-side castling. Now Reti has a forced mate.
moves.9. Qd8+: He begins with a Queen sacrifice.
moves.9... Kxd8 10. Bg5+: Reti continues with a double check.
moves.10... Kc7: Tartakower is doomed either way. If 10...K-K1, Reti plays 11 R-Q8 mate.
moves.11. Bd8#: Instead, he mates with the Bishop. Fine attacking play.
